content: Hey does anyone know whether there's a code in LOINC or SNOMED for how long you can hold your breath for? This is being used as a clinical symptom in a suite of covid risk factors, but no obvious code leapt out at me...
thanks! How stupid of me not to think of searching for Apnea....
I guess the term "apnea" might be ambiguous though, is it voluntary or not
right. Is average or longest? the definition isn't really clear
Generally, apnea means pathological/passive suspension or absence of breathing while holding breath is voluntary.
No LOINC codes for the latter is found for now.

There are some loosely related finding concepts such as:
713013008 |Breath holding spell (finding)|
90091006 |Breath holding with temper (finding)|
those 2 snomd ct codes look like about angry children to me. See https://www.everythingasterix.com/news-and-views-content/asterix-world-cup-quarter-final-2

To me this sounds like a LOINC observable, not a finding in SNOMED CT. I agree, LOINC doesn't seem to have anything that works for this (there are some vent settings..) I suspect this is a LOINC request. @Grahame Grieve , you going to do that? Also agree this is not apnea
I may do it. I don't have time right now

I'm not fussed whether it's LOINC or SNOMED CT. The particular project doing this has a long list of observations some of which are extremely clinical and way outside LOINC's current scope, where as there are obvious SCT codes, and some are very much LOINC space. Others - like this one - are in between
The border between those two, and making up our own, is murky at best. But this one, given the situation, I think should be a LOINC. Something like "Breath holding capability" measured in seconds?

Its FSN might be:
Longest duration of breath holding:Time:Pt:Respiratory system:Qn:[Methodless].
There is an agreement between these SDOs to avoid duplicate efforts and enhance content consistency.

"Breath holding capability" measured in seconds?

yep that one.
